intro: Psychotria trisulcata, commonly known as the three-ridged psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, Colombia, and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with three distinct ridges running along the midrib. It produces small, white to greenish flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Psychotria trisulcata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
